comment.author: 66311327@N05
comment._content: Formerly Grace Carr, „one of the most admired American woman in English high society“, see The San Francisco call., August 03, 1913, Page 24 (with photo). The Evening herald., September 20, 1919, Page 5 (with photo) says that she married William Charles Wynne, Lord Newborough in 1900. Her husband fell in action during WWI. Her husband was then William Charles Wynn, 4th Baron Newborough (1873–1916) (according to en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Baron_Newborough)

comment.author: 66311327@N05
comment._content: On the other hand, the New-York tribune., December 14, 1919, Page 3 (with photo) says that she was the wife of Thomas John Wynn, that would be the 5th Baron Newborough (1878–1957).

comment.author: 66311327@N05
comment._content: A report about her wedding in The evening world., November 07, 1900, Evening Edition, Page 11, "KENTUCKY BELLE NOW MY LADY NEWBOROUGH" (with photo) names her husband Charles Wynn, so I presume that the article in the New-York Tribune is mistaken.

comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: A blog post, entitled "Las Princesas Dólar" dinastias.forogratis.es/las-princesas-dolar-t3153-204.html has a picture whose caption agrees that Grace Carr's husband was William Charles, 4th Baron and clearly shows the same woman as in this Bain photo. NYT obituary for the 4th Baron on July 20, 1916 query.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=F60A15FC355B17738... agrees. Lots of ways to express Grace Carr's title are given in the description of a 1928 photo at digital.library.louisville.edu/cdm/ref/collection/heraldp....

comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: www.cracroftspeerage.co.uk/online/content/index495.htm has details for the 4th and 5th barons, who were brothers. Perhaps the 1919 New-York Tribune photo is of a different Lady Newborough. Vera Evelyn Mary Winch, widow of Henry L Winch, dau. of Capt Philip Montagu[e?], of Down Hall, Dorset was the wife of the 5th baron. Although why she should be in the New-York Tribune I can't imagine.
